description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 12 (Number of Events/Guests) of Planning Permission ref: 17/14564/FUL (Continued use of premises for dinner, bed & breakfast, in addition to its use for residential training and conferences, weddings, wedding receptions, and other private functions and events (sui generis) ) dated 28/02/2018. Condition to be varied to read as "Weddings and Civil Marriages shall be restricted to no more than 50 per annum and other private functions with in excess of 50 guests unrelated to the use of the premises as a residential conference and training centre shall be restricted to no more than 25 per annum (10 of which without amplified music). In any event all such functions shall be restricted to no more than 100 guests''

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The playing of amplified music other than as indicated below, shall be confined to the area identified by cross hatching on plan DRH2 attached to this decision and shall not exceed 93dB:LAeq:5min as measured within the room. A noise meter shall be set up within the London Room to record music over consecutive 5 minute periods and the data made available to the council if requested. For the avoidance of doubt this condition shall not prohibit amplified music used as an aid in seminars, lectures, presentations and actual wedding ceremonies.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

No music shall be played within the premises between midnight and 0700 the following day without the prior approval in writing of the local planning authority.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012
There shall be no playing amplified music on Sundays.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

The close boarded timber acoustic fence adjacent to the refuse area marked 'C' linking the main building to the ancillary buildings as indicated on plan reference DRH2 shall be retained and maintained for the life of the development in accordance with the details approved by the local planning authority on 6 June 2005 [Council reference 05/ 14312/ REM].Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

There shall be no playing of live or amplified music outside the buildings at any time.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

Windows to the indoor swimming pool shall be kept permanently closed.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

Subject to the restrictions in conditions 11 and 14 of this permission [and other than in relation to the car park) the grounds shall not be used by guests during any celebration or party, including a function of a similar social or celebratory nature, between 2200 and 0700 the following day.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

The opening windows in the bay marked 'B to the London Room, the doors to Lilac Room marked 'A' And the patio doors adjacent to the London Room marked 'D' as shown on plan reference DRH2, attached to this decision, shall be kept closed whilst amplified music is played, and in any event between 2000 and 0700 the following day, during any celebration or party, including a function of a similar social or celebratory nature, except in an emergency.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

The area stippled in black on plan reference DRH2 shall not be available to or be used by guests during any celebration or party, including a function of a similar social or celebratory nature between 2000 and 0700 the following day.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

For a period up until 22nd February 2025, weddings and civil marriages shall be restricted to no more than 50 per annum. From 19th January 2025, weddings and civil marriages shall be restricted to no more than 25 per annum, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Other private functions with in excess of 50 guests unrelated to the use of the premises as a residential conference and training centre shall be restricted to no more than 25 per annum (10 of which without amplified music). In any event all such functions shall be restricted to no more than 100 guests.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

Detailed bookings associated with all weddings and other private functions unrelated to the use of the premises as a residential conference and training centre shall be submitted to the local planning authority on request in writing and a complete record of all such events that have taken place shall be submitted to the local planning authority at the end of each calendar year.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

The areas diagonally hatched on plan reference DRH2 shall not be used by guests during any celebration or party, including a function of a similar social or celebratory nature at any time and shall not be used by persons attending the premises for residential conference and training purposes at any time during the weekend.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

Food shall not be served in the restaurant between midnight and 0700 hours, other than to guests attending residential training, conferences, weddings, wedding receptions, or other private functions and events.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

Within six months of the date of this decision secure covered cycle parking shall be provided on site and thereafter permanently maintained and kept available for cycle parking purpose in accordance with details submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: to ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policy DM8 [sustainable transport for new developments] of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012

Within 2 months of the date of this planning permission, a noise limiter shall be installed in the London Room, limiting amplified noise levels to no more than 93 dB in accordance with condition 3, and shall be maintained thereafter.Within 6 months of the date of this planning permission, a verification report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority demonstrating that the noise limiter was installed and operational no later than 2 months from the date of this permission and effectively limits amplified noise levels to the required level set out in condition 3. For the avoidance of doubt this condition shall not prohibit amplified music used as an aid in seminars, lectures, presentations and actual wedding ceremonies, in accordance with condition 3.Reason: to protect the amenities of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy adopted April 2012
